content.question: Specialty agriculture and timber production have increased the level of development and gross national income (GNI) of Chileâ€™s economy through which of the following?

choices.label: Export sales to consumers in the United States, Japan, and other foreign markets
Creation of a trade alliance with Brazil and Argentina
Provision of basic staple foods and building materials to Chilean consumers
An increase in shipping trade from ports along the Strait of Magellan
A focus on plant-based produce that has a long shelf life and does not require preservatives

content.answer: Export sales to consumers in the United States, Japan, and other foreign markets

unit.text: 7: Industrial and Economic Development Patterns and Processes

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Explain spatial relationships in a specified context or region of the world, using geographic concepts, processes, models, or theories.
